revised_title: Temperature Determinations in Earth's Upper Atmosphere: Optical Methods and Techniques
tldr: This article discusses various spectrographic and interferometric techniques used to determine the temperature of the Earth's upper atmosphere, focusing on auroral and airglow emissions. The authors explore different methods, such as temperature photometers and Fabry-Perot interferometers, and their applications in studying the temperature gradient and variations in the stratosphere, mesosphere, and lower thermosphere.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
